reviewText: A well produced story about an amazing man.
Excellent video of a truly great pilot.  Highly recommended for anyone interested in aviation.

Bottom Line:
Eric Brown, A Pilots Story is somewhat low key and a bit technical for some viewers. If you have an interest in the more technical side of WWII air warfare, or in the history of aircraft design, this is your documentary. It lacks some the kinds of modern computer animation and other flashier techniques of more recent documentaries. It has an almost stereotypical Englishness to it. Most import it has Eric Brown. The much decorated flyer was an interesting man and lived a fascinating life. This is his story and he carries it.

To call Capt. Eric Winkle Brown the British General Chuck Yaeger is not too much of a stretch. Had he heard you do so, I think you would have gotten a taste of his Scotch pride. Captain Brown was not one to take or have his nation take second place to any American.

In this documentary, A Pilots Story the retired warrior and test pilot represents himself and helps gives us an insiders look into the business of wartime flying and later of being one of the first, and by documentation, the most experienced modern test pilots. The Documentary will only say that he holds a number of records. You have to turn to Wiki to get the details. In short, he flew the most different kinds of aircraft, over 450, conducted several first time landings on an aircraft carrier: First for a two engine aircraft (a Mosquito) and the 1st Jet powered aircraft among others. Had the flight program not been cancelled, Capt. Brown and not Chuck Yaeger would have been the first to fly at supersonic speeds.
Eric Brown was the British Chuck Yeager, which is very high praise indeed. His story is priceless.
Very informative
The whole story before and after. He led a charmed life it sounds like the JC wire might have had something to do with that..
good film about a great pilot.
Great documentary about an incredible individual.
Great interviews with "Winkle' Brown in which he describes a number of what to him were everyday occurrences, which to anyone else would have been hair raising incidents
Fantastic- what an incredible man/pilot!
Amazing story!
Great story
Very interesting
Excellent documentary that revealed a number of interesting and lesser known facts in aviation history from a personal, first person perspective.  Captain Brown is clearly a pilot's pilot.
Excellent! Eric Brown is a real unsung hero and all time great aviator.
fantastic

Amazing biography of a true WW ll hero. That Capt. Brown was still alive and sharp minded when the film was produced many years after the war had ended is a real bonus as he provided his own narrative.

Well done!
Great story telling and good show
Thoroughly enjoyed
excellent soure of aviation history
Great Story and quite an intelligent guy.
Aaaaa

Mr Brown's story is truly inspiring. He has set aviation records that will never be be broken. He is a true gentleman and and an amazing individual. He has flown everything from biplanes to supersonic jets and all with amazing skill. I highly recommend this documentary. Mr Brown is one of a kind.
Wonderful story about one of the greatest pilots every.
Very cool!
Well done, interesting video and commentary.  He was quite the pilot!
An aviation hero of the old school, great story
A largely unknown pilot who was truly one of the best.
VERY INTERESTING

Eric Brown was one of the most amazing test pilots of World War II.  First-hand account of his experiences flying over 450 different types of aircraft from all nations  He logged over 2,600 carrier landings, survived a carrier sinking, and lived a charmed life.
The story of an amazing man in his own words. You would have to go far to find a more intriguing story. Recommended for anyone interested in e history of flight from a personal view.
Great autobiographical story of Britain's most famous test pilot. 'Winkle' tells his own life story accompanied by pictures and movies from his long career in naval aviation. Highly recommended!
Read his book and enjoyed his video

A first-rate documentary on a first-rate man. Told in his own modest & insightful way, this quiet legend, Eric Brown, shares with us not only his experiences with the aircraft he flew to war and test-flew, breaking new ground and records all along the way, but also his 1-to-1 experience of several of history's great villains. Any devotee of aviation will love this documentary and also warm to the quiet humanity of Eric "Winkle" Brown.

Good lord! Can anyone get subtitles right?! Ridiculous and shameful. This man and this history deserves better respect and treatment.

Fabulous story about an amazing pilot. Flew it all, seen it all, done it all! He'd probably laugh about those last two.

A trove of aviation and human history. Not to be missed.
Would enjoy more like this.
Great story of a very humble but obviously very brave Brit.
Unsung hero telling an armchair, interesting story of his military life.  He was one of the greats and he candidly presents his WW2 exploits with the wisdom of a life that was honorably lived

Born at the perfect time to see aviation evolve from piston engines and propellors to jets, the only allied pilot to fly a Me 163 under power, and one of first and the few to fly and evaluate all of the last generation of German fighters and bombers right at the end of the war. "Winkle"  Brown was amoung the best naval carrier pilots and one of the most highly skilled test pilots of his generation.
Great video
Interesting points of view from our Brit cousins.  While I had never heard of Mr. Brown, it was by chance I took time to watch the movie, glad I did.
